A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a vicious aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an exorbitant price. The girl decides to accept the terms in order to ruin the aristocrat, only to be demeaned by the irony of taking a price in order to right a wrong.
MAINSTREET

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning of Miyazawa’s life at the beginning of the Showa period and the ending at the beginning of World War II. This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The movie is as dark and depressing as only Apartheid can be, and continues the theme of the restructuring of South Africa to a post-Apartheid state, and looks at the rise, fall, and betrayal

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to fend for itself when the boy moves away, has gone feral and taken to killing townsfolk, who fear and avoid the cat because it is apparently a werewolf in cat form.
